titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1593: Confutatio libelli Philippi Melanchtonis cuius titulus est De officio principum, quod mandatum dei praecipiat eis tollere abusus ecclesiasticos

notesStmt.note: Each of the printed works is cataloged individually; to retrieve those records as a set, search for the call number as a phrase.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: A detailed refutation of De officio principum by Philipp Melanchthon, bound into the middle of a collection of printed works by Johannes Cochlaeus, whose own challenge to the works of Melancthon follows the work by Apel.

msItem.title: Confutatio libelli Philippi Melanchtonis cuius titulus est De officio principum, quod mandatum dei praecipiat eis tollere abusus ecclesiasticos

supportDesc.extent: 31 leaves : 198 x 146 (166 x 96) mm. bound to 212 x 160 mm

collation.p: Paper, 31; 1¹⁰ 2⁸ 3⁶ 4⁸(-1); [1-31], modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto, manuscript portion of volume only.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script, possibly in the hand of the author (Zacour-Hirsch).

binding.p: Contemporary blindpressed pigskin (Zacour-Hirsch) over wooden boards with two clasps.

history.provenance: Early ownership inscriptions for volume by Joannes Salzperg (inside upper cover); Stephanus Rosinus of Augsburg, canon of Passau (first printed title page); and the Jesuits of Altötting (Societatis Jesu Oetingae, first printed title page).
Purchased, 1959; transferred from Culture Class collection, 2011.

keywords.term: Lutheran Church--Controversial literature--Catholic authors--Early works to 1800

surface.n: Title page; printed matter not shot
